SOUND OF MACHINE WHIRRING ABOVE. BOOM
HIS THOUGHTS APPEAR IN THREE DIMENSIONAL SPACE BEHIND HIM
TOGGLE BETWEEN OTHER DIMENSIONS, IT FEELS LIKE A SUBWAY C
HIS BACK, BAD INVESTMENTS, DOOR SLAMMING, GETTING HIT BY
HIM AND YANKS HIM BACK TO-
ON MILES, PETER, GWEN AND OCK

dialogues.speaker: RIO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Miles! Miles, time for school!

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --Miles! Miles! MILES! --Miles WHIPS OFF his headphones--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? !--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you finished packing for school?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah! Just ironing my last shirt! Reveal his EMPTY BAG. He is NOT PACKED. He’s been AVOIDIN IT.

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: iVamo chacho! --He FLIES around the room, tossing VARIOUS ITEMS into th suitcase, throwing on a BLUE UNIFORM JACKET, the camera catching other childhood details--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: C'mon, you a grown man now! Let show these teachers that. Let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: RIO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --Miles! INT. MILES’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM BAM! The door flies open. FAST-PACED, Miles enters the li room, where his parents get ready for the day.

dialogues.speaker: MILES RIO
dialogues.text: Where’s my laptop? éDonde le dejaste?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: TYo no se!

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --If you want me to drive you we gotta go now--

dialogues.speaker: MILES JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (edging away) Personal chauffeur going once- --No Dad, I’1l walk!-- -

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (continuing) --It’s ok--

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: Ay Maria, este nene me tiene loca!  4. Miles grabs food. Mom and dad frantically cross behind hi

dialogues.speaker: RIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (impatient) Miles, gotta go!!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (chewing) In a minute!

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: (sing-song) Gotta Go-ohh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rio SMOTHERS an embarrassed Miles with kisses. Miles roll his eyes, hates it/loves it.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Mom. I gotta go...

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: (kissing him) In a minute... Miles rolls his bag down the steps as Rio calls out:

dialogues.speaker: RIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Papa! Llamame! See you Friday!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Okay, mami. Hasta luego!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles struggles down the street with the heavy bag, but h in his element. He walks by his old school, BROOKLYN MIDD passes some OLD FRIENDS, who he loves and misses.

dialogues.speaker: OLD FRIEND 1
dialogues.text: Ohhhhh. Look who’s back! Yo what’s going on, bro?--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --Hey, I’m just walking by, how you doing?--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Miles! éTe va bien en la escuela?-

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --Seguro que si--

dialogues.speaker: OLD FRIEND 3
dialogues.text: Yo, Miles did you feel that earthquake last night?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I slept like a baby last night.

dialogues.speaker: OLD FRIEND 5 MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s that new school? --So easy!--

dialogues.speaker: OLD FRIEND 5
dialogues.text: We miss you, Miles!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You miss me? I still live here! Wait, you miss me? TIME CUT: Miles RUNS DOWN THE STREET, SLAPS his HOMEMADE STICKERS on some things, ends by SLAPPING a STOP SIGN, ma a LOUD CLANG-- --but he trips on his shoe laces and falls into the stree

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: iContra! --POLICE LIGHTS FLASH along with the signature BWOOP BWOO

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (knows what's coming) Ah c’/mon... SEQ. 0425 - SITTING BACK THERE “SBI”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE CAR moves through the neighborhood. Miles is i the back seat. 1010 WINS plays.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Seriously, Dad, walking would have been fine. Reveal Jefferson driving. Miles' dad is a COP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can walk plenty on Saturday when you peel those stickers off.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You saw that? I don’t know if that was me, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: And the two from yesterday on Clinton.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah. Those were me. Jefferson stares, shuts down the cheekiness. Miles looks hurt. Jefferson clocks his pained look. It bums Jefferson out. There’s an awkwardness between Miles and his dad tha not there with his mom. They drive by a row of HIPSTER COFFEE SHOPS. Jefferson tr to bridge the gap with Miles, more cheerful:

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Soooo... look at that, another new coffee shop... you see that Miles?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Totally, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --You see that one, what’s that one called?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Foam Party.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Foam Party, come on...and I see it-- everyone is just lining up! You see that, Miles--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Is that a coffee shop or a disco?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Dad, you’re old, man.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: There are multiple reports of another mysterious seismic event last night. Sources close to Spider- Man say he is looking into the problem.  7. Jefferson shakes his head, disapproving, turns off the ra

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Spider-Man. I mean this guy swings in once a day zip zap zop in his little mask and answers to no one, right?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And meanwhile my guys are out Uh huh... there, lives on the line-- SCHOOL KIDS run alongside the car looking at Miles, who slinks down. They bang on the window, teasing Miles, “you arrested?!”

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --no masks, we show our --Oh no! Dad, speed up, I faces. Accountability. know these kids--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --You know, with great ability comes great accountability--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: That’s not even how the saying goes, Dad--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --I do like his cereal though, I'11 give him that-- Jeff stops the car. The teens reach Miles’ window.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN BOY
dialogues.text: Yo Miles! You get arrested?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (mortified) --Oh my gosh. Don’t cops run red lights?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Some do... but not your Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives up right under the Brooklyn Bridge, to a school overlooking MANHATTAN, which LOOMS across the wate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up. Miles sits, not wanting to go in.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Why can’t I go back to Brooklyn Middle?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: (raises his eyebrows) Miles, you’ve given it two weeks. We're not having this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --I just think that this new school is elitist--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --Elitist?--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --and I would prefer to be at a normal school among the people.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: The people? These are your people!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --I'm only here ‘cause I won that stupid lottery--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: No way. You passed the entry test just like everybody else, ok! You have an opportunity here, you wanna blow that, huh? You want to end up like your Uncle?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (under his breath) --What’s wrong with Uncle Aaron? He’s a good guy-- --Jefferson FLINCHES, angered. Reins it in.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: ..-We all make choices in life--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --It doesn't feel like I have a choice right now--

dialogues.speaker: --YOU DON'T
dialogues.text: Tension fills the car. They sit in silence for a beat. Miles gets out of the car and opens the front door to get bag Jefferson staring through his rearview mirror--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, Dad. See you Friday-- --Miles shuts the door and walks away. Jefferson watches, bummed at the state of the relationship. He lifts his P.A

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (INTO P.A.)
dialogues.text: You gotta say I love you back.

dialogues.speaker: MILES JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad are you serious? I wanna hear it.

dialogues.speaker: MILES JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanna hear me say it-- --I love you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: MILES JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --You’re dropping me off at a --I love you Dad. school--

dialogues.speaker: MILES JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at this place-- --Dad, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Dad, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (INTO P.A.)
dialogues.text: That’s a copy. Tie your shoes please! SEQ. 0200 - THE LOTTERY WINNER “TLW”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP from UNTIED SHOES -- Miles clocks them but defiant

dialogues.speaker: DOES NOT TIE THEM-
dialogues.text: --Miles walks through a LOBBY filled with TALLER KIDS in IDENTICAL BLUE UNIFORMS. A cutting-edge LAB SCHOOL in a converted industrial building.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: I love you, Dad!  10. In a SEA OF BLUE, Miles awkwardly tries to interact like was on his street but everyone's so focused.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Hey good morning. How you doing?... Weekend was short, huh? (he turns to another kid) Oh my gosh this is embarrassing, we wore the same jacket-- MILES P.O.V. -- The UNIFORMED KIDS just pass by. Miles is discouraged.

dialogues.speaker: PASSING STUDENT MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey-- (hopeful) --Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: PASSING STUDENT
dialogues.text: --Your shoe’s untied.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m aware. It’s a choice. And as his SHOULDERS DROOP he turns to walk into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A MATH TEACHER in front of a BAFFLING FORMULA.

dialogues.speaker: MATH TEACHER
dialogues.text: --Who can solve this for XY?-- --A LOGIC TEACHER in front of an ELABORATE PROOF.

dialogues.speaker: LOGIC TEACHER
dialogues.text: --And that is known as a syllogism. --IN JUMPCUTS Miles walks back and forth across the hallw Each time he is holding more paper and books in his arms, getting more and more WEIGHED DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH TEACHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --en este clase, se habla castellano--

dialogues.speaker: LITERATURE TEACHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --Tonight, read two chapters of Great Expectations-—-

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE TEACHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --I’m giving you a take-home quiz on volumetric pressure--  11.

dialogues.speaker: HEALTH TEACHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --a five page essay with your conclusions stressed--

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS TEACHERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Workers Party/ Take-home Work/ Industrial Revolution/ Incapable/ An enormous change/ Unstoppable--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --The MONTAGE BUILDS, a MULTI-PANELLED FLURRY--

dialogues.speaker: PRELAP
dialogues.text: He runs through the EMPTYING HALLWAYS. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students sit in a DARKENED CLASSROOM, lit only by a large screen playing a DOCUMENTARY.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICIST
dialogues.text: --countless other possibilities. There could be a universe where I am wearing red. Or wearing leather pants-- The door BURSTS OPEN -- MILES, out of breath, is silhouet in the doorway. The TEACHER FLIPS THE LIGHTS on. STUDENTS blink in the br light and grumble.

dialogues.speaker: MS. CALLEROS
dialogues.text: Mr. Morales, moving in the dark. You're late again.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Einstein said time was relative, right? Maybe I’m not late. Maybe you guys are early. Miles’ joke is met with unamused SILENCE. Except for a si TITTER from a NEW GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: Sorry. It was just so quiet.

dialogues.speaker: MS. CALLEROS
dialogues.text: Would you like to keep standing there or do you want to sit down? Someone HITS THE LIGHTS. In the dark, Miles awkwardly mak his way to his seat, BANGS into a desk in the dark.  12. Onscreen is a PHYSICIST, identified as “Director, Alchema Laboratories.” She’s the consummate nerd and AMPED about physics.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICIST
dialogues.text: Our universe is in fact one of many parallel universes happening at the exact same time. Thanks to everyone here at the Fisk Family Foundation for the Sciences, I will prove they exist when I build my supercollider. All I need is 10 billion dollars. Chump change, right? ON MILES, he BONKS INTO THE DESK of a NEW GIRL, paying ra attention and sits down at the desk beside her. Miles checks out the girl, who catches him looking. Miles looks away. Looks back -- she’s still looking.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: I liked your joke.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: I mean, it wasn’t funny, that’s why I laughed. But it was smart, so I liked it.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (taken aback, then) I don’t think I’ve seen you before-- --Ms. Calleros SHUSHES Miles, cutting him off.

dialogues.speaker: MS. CALLEROS
dialogues.text: Shhhhh! Miles sits -- checks out the new girl but she’s again focussed on the documentary. Miles is INTRIGUED.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICIST
dialogues.text: Every choice that we make, would create countless other possibilities. A What-if to infinity.  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles stands in front of Ms. Calleros’ desk as she slides zero with a 0/100 written on it.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: A zero? A few more of those and you probably have to kick me outta here huh? Maybe I’m just not right for this school?

dialogues.speaker: MS. CALLEROS
dialogues.text: If a person wearing a blind fold picked the answers on a true or false quiz at random, do you know what score they would get?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Fifty percent?

dialogues.speaker: MS. CALLEROS
dialogues.text: That’s right!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Wait wait!

dialogues.speaker: MS. CALLEROS
dialogues.text: The only way to get all the answers wrong, is to know which answers were right. You’re trying to quit. And I’m not going to let you. I’m assigning you a personal essay. Not about physics, but about you and what kind of person you want to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles stares at his STACK OF HOMEWORK. He takes out a leg pad to start on his Great Expectations paper. He sighs. Frustrated, Miles looks out the window for a beat. Miles SMILES -- he has a MISCHIEVOUS IDEA. SEQ. 0500 - A NIGHT WITH AARON “NWA”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles moves down a street, alive with nighttime city ener Once again the CAREFREE kid he yearns to be. Moving AWAY the Manhattan skyline and turning into--  14. --AN ALLEY, where he sees a light on in the top apartment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE AARON is texting on his couch when he receives a picture text of him, texting, from 1 second ago. Uncle Aa looks at his window and sees Miles--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (laughing) Uncle Aaroooooon! Hey! Were you scared?! Miles PRESSES HIS FACE UP AGAINST THE WINDOW making a fun face. TIME CUT -- Aaron washes dishes as Miles SPARS with Aaron PUNCHING BAG not-very-competently: MILES (CONT’D) You want that, huh? Unh. Unh.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: What’s up with school?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Going great. Got tons of friends.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: You can't tell me it’s all that bad there... smart girls is where it’s at. Place must be full of ‘em. Aaron walks over to the punching bag and holds it for Mil

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: No, there’s no one. There’s no one. Aaron walks over to the microwave to get some popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: ...-Yo I cannot have a nephew of mine on the streets with no game.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I got game! (fronting) There was a new girl, actually, she's kinda into me. You know how it is.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: What's her name?  Miles 15. sits on the couch, and SCRIBBLES in his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (stutters, until--) --You know we... this is... we’re laying down the ground work right now. Uncle Aaron reacts, amused by Miles effort to sound cool.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: You know about the shoulder touch?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Of course I do! But tell me anyway.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: Tomorrow find that girl, walk up to her and be like... (does shoulder touch) "Hey".

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (laughing) You serious Uncle Aaron?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: I'm telling you man, it's science.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: So walk up to her and be like... hey.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: No no no no... like hey...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: "Hey."

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: No. “Heyyy”

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (mocks him) Heyyyyy-

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: You sure you’re my nephew, man? Miles’ phone vibrates. UNCLE AARON (CONT’D) Is that her?  16. Miles has a text from Dad: “Done with that homework?”

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (checking his phone) I should probably go. Still got a paper to do tonight. Aaron sees this text and then casually but deliberately changes the subject to Miles’ drawings in his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: --Yo, you’ve been holding out on me. You throw these up yet?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: No, man, you know my dad. I can’t. --Aaron stands. He crosses out of frame, Miles getting

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: C’mon. I got a spot you ain’t gonna believe.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I can’t! I can’t I can’t--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Aaron make their way out of a subway car and wa for it to clear.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get in so much trouble.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: Hey man, tell them your art teacher made you.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Hey, how did you know about this place?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: Did an engineering job down here. SEQ. 0520 - SUBWAY SPIDER BITE “SSB”  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Miles walk deeper and deeper down the tunnels a approach an ELECTRIFIED floor-to-ceiling FENCE. RACK TO a A1CHEMAX PRIVATE PROPERTY SIGN, and other HIGH SECURITY PARAPHERNALIA. Someone really wants people to stay out. Aaron expertly CLIMBS A FENCE, drops down on the other si Miles climbs the fence. We STAY ON AARON as we hear Miles struggle. Finally Miles lands next to Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Wassup? Uncle Aaron laughs.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah man I knew we were related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron leads Miles into a huge space. Empty walls and spiderwebs as far as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Whoa... (then, for the echoes) BROOKLYN! Brooklyn! Brooklyn! The room is full of BEAUTIFUL STREET ART -- it’s a secret spot.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: There’s a lot of history on these walls.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: This is so fresh. Aaron gestures to a wall that’s been RECENTLY CLEANED AND PREPPED...clearly by Aaron. Aaron smiles, leans down to his BAG and unzips it, reveal KRYLON SPRAY PAINT CANS. He tosses a can to Miles. Presse PLAY on a stereo. Miles SMILES-- --and starts painting. Aaron turns over a BENCH.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: Now you’re on your own, Miles. (then) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, slow down a little... that's better... that’s perfect. Unbeknownst to them, a faintly glowing SPIDER descends on web, towards the ground and towards the cans! UNCLE AARON (CONT’D) (coaching him) The real Miles, comin’ out of hiding. Now you can cut that line with another color. That’s it...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Little help? CUT TO Miles on Uncle Aaron’s shoulders. For a beat afterward, they paint TOGETHER.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: You want drips? ‘Cause if you do, that’s cool, but if you don’t you gotta keep it moving...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: That’s intentional! Aaron traces Miles’ silhouette on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: Wow. Miles steps back, admiring his work. A STRIKING PIECE, bu around Miles silouette with nothing painted inside it. A BLANK. “No Expectations” written above.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (suddenly embarrassed) Is it too crazy?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: No man. Miles I see exactly what you're doing here, man. Miles smiles. So happy to finally be seen. UNCLE AARON (CONT’D) Yeah. You know me and your Dad used to do this back in the day.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Stop lying.  19.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON
dialogues.text: It’s true. Then he took on the cop thing... and I don’t know. He’s a good guy, just... you know what I’m saying... Aaron's phone VIBRATES, he READS a message. A shadow acro his face. UNCLE AARON (CONT’D) All right, come on man. I gotta roll. Aaron walks out of the tunnel leaving Miles alone. Miles takes one last look at their PAINTING and takes a picture it on his phone. There's the SPIDER, on the back of Miles’ hand. It BITES WE JUMP INTO PSYCHEDELIC 2D ANIMATION, watching the VENOM make it’s way into MILES’ BLOOD STREAM, BUILDING UNTIL-- --Miles flicks the spider and it falls off his hand. UNCLE AARON (CONT’D) Miles, let’s go! Miles, hiding the bite, runs to join his Uncle. SEQ. 0700 - PUBERTY “PUB”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME LAPSE: As the moon rises, Miles shifts positions. It restless sleep, the spider-bite faintly glows, Miles star to sweat... While Miles tosses and turns, his roomate Ganke works on computer, taking a break to read “The True Life Tales of Spider-Man” comic book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles gets up and puts his pants on. They are too short.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's weird. My pants shrank. The words "that's weird" are VISUALIZED onscreen. Miles l up, SURPRISED by the sound of his own Spider-Man voice-ov  20.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I think I hit puberty. Ganke stops typing at this laptop, eyes wide. He quickly resumes his work as the words “I should have kept that to myself” appear thought-bubbled next to Miles. SEQ. 0730 - WHY AM I SO SWEATY? “SWI”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles walks the halls, awkwardly trying to pull down his pants that are now suddenly too short for him. As he spea

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I gotta get new pants. Wait, why is the voice in my head so loud? (then) What-- --His strut is interrupted by a high-pitched WHINE that S when he bumps into the NEW GIRL FROM PHYSICS CLASS.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: Oh! Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why am I so sweaty??? Why are you so sweaty?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: It's a puberty thing. I don't know why I said that. I’m not going through puberty. I did. But I’m done. (“cool” and deep voice) I’m a man. (tries to be suave) --So you're, like, new here, right? We got that in common.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s one thing.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Cool, yeah. I’m Miles.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: I'm G-Waaaanda.  21.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Wait, your name is Gwanda?

dialogues.speaker: GWANDA
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s African. I'm South African. No accent though, cause I was raised here. Gwanda continues, though her voice FADES AWAY...

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do the shoulder touch now! Before she walks away! In SLOW MOTION, Miles' hand heads toward Gwanda's shoulde she watches its slow, deliberate journey.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why is this so scary? Am I doing this in slow motion or does it just feel that way?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: .--I'm kidding. It's Wanda. No G. That's crazy. The hand lands. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (“cool” and deep voice) “Hey.”

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: OK then. I’1l see you around.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Oh. See you. Miles is mortified. Wanda turns to leave but is jerked ba by Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry... um... oh crap--

dialogues.speaker: WANDA MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --Hey! Um, can you let go --I can't... let... go... please? Ow ow ow ow ow, calm down, it’s fine-- Miles is STUCK to her. He tries to unstick himself but it keeps getting worse. Now Wanda's hair is involved.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Miles, let go!  22.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. It's just puberty!

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I don’t think you know what puberty is! Just relax.

dialogues.speaker: MILES WANDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I have a plan. Great.

dialogues.speaker: MILES WANDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to pull REALLY That’s a terrible plan. hard.

dialogues.speaker: MILES WANDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 1... 2... --Don’t do this!--
Wanda finally has enough and FLIPS Miles, in full view of dozens of students. Miles SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: Pre-lap: An electric razor BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles looks on as his hand is freed from Wanda’s hair. Miles’ expression tells us her hair is ravaged. And it is

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. She won’t even look at him.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Sure. Total pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting, Miles balls his hair-covered hands and puts them his pockets. He walks the halls, mortified.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No one saw. It’s ok. No one knows. No one knows. (everyone is staring) Everyone knows. Everyone knows!  23. The sentence “EVERYONE KNOWS” appears behind him, giant letters. The period appears last like a CANNONBALL.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: They’re talking about me. They saw everything. He knows. She knows. They know. (distracted by a tall girl) Wow. She's super tall. Why is he smiling? Am I the weird guy now? What am I doing? How do I stop? Can they hear my thoughts? Why are all my thoughts so loud?! The SCHOOL SECURITY GUARD appears--

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: --Hey! I know you snuck out last night, Morales.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (V.O./THOUGHT BUBBLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play dumb. (to the security guard) Who’s Morales? (V.O./THOUGHT BUBBLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that dumb. SEQ. 0790 - SPIDER-MAN SYMPTOMS “SMS” --Panicking, Miles TAKES OFF RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: --Hey! Miles rounds a corner and runs down the hall trying. He finds an open door and runs into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles slams the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're okay. You’re okay. You’re okay. He’ll never find you. He SPINS to LOOK AROUND THE OFFICE, and sees, to his horr a PHOTO OF THE SECURITY GUARD AND HIS BUDDIES.  24.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard reaches the door, starts to bang. We now see th sign on the door: SECURITY OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE OFFICE
dialogues.text: Miles is stuck, yanking on the door. His HAND pulls away, ripping off the DOOR'S VENEER. He stands, his hands sticking to his shirt and accidental YANKING IT OVER HIS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my office Morales?! Morales! Open up! Unable to see he RUNS DIRECTLY INTO A BOOKSHELF, then sti to it, pulling it down IN FRONT OF THE DOOR. He hits the laptop and Spider-man’s Christmas song ("Spidey Bells”) starts to play.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (VO/THOUGHT BUBBLE)
dialogues.text: Why is this happening? Outside in the hallway, the security guard notices the ki reacting to the song playing from his office.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (sheepish) It’s my kids playlist. --Miles TRIPS and ROLLS UP THE WALL -- circling the four walls like a dervish, he sticks to the ceiling and “break dances.” SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) Open up!

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O./THOUGHT BALLOON)
dialogues.text: (exerting himself) Stop... sticking! He falls onto a DESK CHAIR and then ROLLS OUT THE WINDOW!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: Miles sticks straight out his window sill, sticky feet th only thing preventing him from falling down.  25.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O./THOUGHT BUBBLE)
dialogues.text: Keep sticking, Miles! Miles struggles to get inside. He rolls onto an ADJACENT WINDOW where A FULL CLASSROOM of TRANSFIXED STUDENTS does notice the horrified Miles on the window--

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: ...-what Hofstadter is suggesting... is that we... look underneath... --Miles rolls AROUND THE BUILDING, rounding a corner -- Suddenly BIRDS fly into him, and somehow become STUCK TO HANDS as they FLAP WILDLY, PECKING AT HIS EYES-- INSIDE THE GLASS HALLWAY, we find WANDA, watching Miles, little perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: «+-OK... BACK WITH MILES, rounding a corner-- He’s back at his dor room!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: My room! IN HIS ROOM, Miles makes his way through his window to th FLOOR. He looks up, breath heaving as a SPIDER-MAN COMIC floats down onto his face. (The True Life Tales of Spider Man) Miles lifts the comic -- it rips a bit -- and looks at it The two-page spread contains panels IDENTICAL TO WHAT MIL JUST EXPERIENCED: A Spider bite. Peter Parker pulling on door ("Why is this happening?", “Please stop sticking!”), rolling out the window, and finally lying the floor, exac where Miles is. MILES (CONT’D) (pure panic) How could there be two Spider-Men? There can’t be two Spider-Men. (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can there? SEQ. 1100 - I DON’T WANT TO BE A SUPERHERO “IDW”

dialogues.speaker: SPLASH PAGE
dialogues.text: On the cover: Miles leans against a glass building, 20 stories up. The REAL SPIDER-MAN is his reflection, but he bigger and cooler looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles races down the street. A phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Come on Uncle Aaron. Pick up. Pick up.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AARON, (PHONE MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: --Yo, it’s Aaron. I'm outta town for a few days. Hit you when I'm back. Peace. His thoughts racing in V.O.:

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No nononono. It's not possible-- --The THOUGHT BUBBLE “NO’S” FLY OFF BEHIND HIM--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: It's just puberty, it’s a normal spider, and I'm a normal kid-- --SCREEEEEEEEECCCHHH!!!! Miles races into the path of an ONCOMING CAR, but reflexes kick in and he VAULTS over it an INSANE SUPER-HEROIC leap that lands him twenty feet aw AMAZED PASSERSBY CHEER. Miles continues on, more freaked out than ever. SEQ. 1150 - BACK THROUGH THE TUNNELS “BIT” ONSCREEN COMIC BOOK BOXES: “Later...Miles searches for answers...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles rides the subway.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I gotta tell someone. He scrolls to his DAD’s number. He thinks to himself for beat, then DECIDES AGAINST IT.  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits the subway, turns toward the DARK TUNNEL he and Uncle Aaron walked into.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You're being crazy Miles. You're being crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MURAL Miles made is still here.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Find the spider. You'll see. The DEAD SPIDER is there. Miles flips it over. It looks W and FLUORESCENT. MILES (CONT’D) It's a normal spider. It’s like boring how normal the spider is... The spider GLITCHES making Miles jump back. Suddenly, Miles hears a RUMBLE. He stands, STARTLED. The rumble STOPS. It appears to be coming from a PITCH BLACK ABANDONED TUNNEL. A surge of SPIDER-SENSE. Overwhelming.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why is this happening to me? SEQ. 1200 - ASSEMBLY ROOM FIGHT “ARF”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles shines his light into darkness. This is SCARY. A LO BLUE TUBE, stamped ALCHEMAX, arcs into the DISTANCE, HUMM Miles’ spider-sense continues to direct him. Another surge of SPIDER-SENSE hits Miles and we hear competing thoughts in his head.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Slow down!/What am I doing? What am I doing? Miles picks up the pace, jogs around the corner, where Mi TURNS, a BIG SURGE OF SPIDER-SENSE and multiple voices ar heard together--  28.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Look out./I don’t want to be a hero!/Look out.

dialogues.speaker: MYSTERIOUS VOICE
dialogues.text: --You'’re like me--

dialogues.speaker: MYSTERIOUS VOICE
dialogues.text: --That’s all it is Miles.-- --You’re like me--

dialogues.speaker: --LOOK OUT-
dialogues.text: --WHAM!!!!! A SUBWAY CAR flies towards him from the next and SMASHES AGAINST THE WALL BESIDE HIM!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive staging room containing Alchemax EQUIPMENT. ZOOM IN ON: SPIDER-MAN. In mid-flight. Backwards. He wrec against some painful looking equipment. ON MILES, TERRIFIED. What's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Norman, listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Spider-Man?!

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I cannot let you open a portal to another dimension! Brooklyn is not zoned for that! PAN to reveal GREEN GOBLIN, a 25' beast with massive wing He unfurls a big BIG BLUE TONGUE.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN GOBLIN
dialogues.text: It’s not up to me.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Is that Green Goblin!?

dialogues.speaker: GREEN GOBLIN
dialogues.text: Why won’t you quit?!  29.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know I guess I like Brooklyn not being sucked into a black hole?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I think I’m gonna go...

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Staten Island maybe, NOT Brooklyn! As Miles turns to run, A GIANT BEAM CRASHES INTO THE ROOM Miles FALLS ON TOP OF IT as it swings back out into the r where Goblin and Spider-Man are FIGHTING. Miles hangs ont the beam for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: No, no! Miles is tossed around the room as Goblin and Spider-Man battle. Green Goblin throws CLUSTER BOMBS as Spider-man swings ar them, and Miles avoids the explosion but now he's EXPOSED This is WAY more real in person. He runs down a MASSIVE HALLWAY, away from the battle. Mil catches himself before tumbling over the end of the hallw into a giant room. SEQ. 1210 - MEET KINGPIN “MKP”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now in an ENORMOUS CHAMBER containing a SUPERCOLLID

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Woah!! Miles looks around the room, confused. MILES (CONT’D) What is this place?-- --Spider-Man and Goblin BURST through doors above him-- --Miles falls STRAIGHT DOWN, but Spidey spots Miles and-- --swings him safely away, high and far from the action. T are on an OBSERVATION LEDGE overlooking the collider cham A beat as they appraise each other. Then:  30.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Did you know your shoes are untied?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: This is a onesie so I don’t really have to worry about it. A beat. Spidey senses something in Miles. Their spider-se RESONATE. Like a mind meld. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) (thrown ) I thought I was the only one. You're like me.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I don’t want to be.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I don’t think you have a choice, kiddo. (gently) Got a lot going through your head, I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: You're gonna be fine. I can help you. If you stick around, I can show you the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (so relieved) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I just need to destroy this big machine real quick before the space time continuum collapses. Don't move. See you in a bit-- --IN AN AMAZING, MIND-BOGGLING MOVE, Spidey jumps away an uses the MASSIVE CHURNING SUPERCOLLIDER to WHIP HIMSELF U until he’s ON THE CEILING, hundreds of yards above, and e level with a CEILING PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How does he do that?  31. He RIPS THE PANEL OUT, reaches in, pulling out COMPLICATE WIRING. He pulls a STRANGE COMPUTERIZED KEY out of his su and tries to plug it INTO A HANGING PORT. Miles watches, IMPRESSED. Spider-Man tries to put the key in the port, but it’s the wrong side, he flips it around, that’s wrong too somehow.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I always get this wrong. As he finally gets it-- a SURGE OF SPIDER-SENSE-- SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) (looks up) Oh boy. --A PURPLE BLUR streaks overhead. TWO PUNCHES from nowher Dazed, Spider-Man looks up and sees a lanky opponent in a purple MASK and SUIT wearing mechanized GLOVES and BOOTS. It's THE PROWLER. As they FLY ACROSS THE ROOM, FIGHTING-- SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) Prowler! Man, I was in the middle of something! Prowler THROWS HIM HARD TO THE GROUND. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) (hitting ground) I am so tired... Prowler lunges towards Spider-Man but Spider-Man expertly dodges the claws and spinning rocket boot kicks-- SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) Are you mad at me? I feel like you’re mad at me. Miles watches from down below, helpless. He SNAPS a pictu on his cell phone. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) Is that all you got? --The GREEN GOBLIN appears and pins Spider-Man to the gro His giant blue tongue lashes around angrily, hitting Spid Man with GIANT GOBS OF SPIT. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) Uhh, so gross.  32.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O./THOUGHT BUBBLES)
dialogues.text: I should go up there and help him! Who am I kidding, I should not do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERRIFIED SCIENTISTS work as SOMETHING HUGE walks through room from behind them. REVEAL KINGPIN, an elaborately-tailored HULK OF A MAN. He walks through the control room towards the windows that f out over the collider room.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: (creepily singing spider- man theme) Dooby do, dooby do. Watch out, here comes the spider-man! (then, over a P.A.) You like my new toy? It cost me a fortune. But hey, you can’t take it with you, right? You came all this way. Watch the test. It’s a hell of a freakin’ light show, you’re gonna love this.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: (panicking now) No! No! Don’t do this! Stop! You don't know what it can do, it’1l kill us all! The collider ROARS ON, lights MOVING UP THE WALLS toward top, as it CRESCENDOES WITH-- CLUNK! A TINY ATMOSPHERIC M in a BOX lowers down, blinking, with a TINNY WHIR... Spider-Man confused as--the SENSOR LOCKS INTO PLACE. --BLAM! The collider behind Spidey ACTIVATES, firing PART BEAMS at the BOX, which FREAKS OUT, it’s readings ON HAYW IT’S CRAZY LOOKING. Kingpin watches, a huge smile. A DREAM COMING TRUE. The scientists are growing EXCITED--

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST 3, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The portal is opening. I see multiple dimensions opening!  33.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PHYSICIST VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was 3... 4... and 5 separate dimensions--

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST 4, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s unstable... we should stop--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Brooklynite looks up from a quivering latte at FOAM PARTY... A minor EARTHQUAKE shakes Brooklyn. But this is no ordina earthquake. Weird colors, weird blurring. 25 TRAFFIC LIGH vibrating in the same space. 25 DIFFERENT-LOOKING CHRYSLE BUILDINGS vibrating in the same space. As we'll later lea this is a “dimensional quake.” Very dangerous. But it loo COOL.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE COLLIDER ROOM
dialogues.text: Spider-Man struggles as Goblin continues to hold him onto ground. The ceiling tiles begin to shake, falling onto Go

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Norm, what’s your take on head trauma? (it hits Goblin) --I tried to warn you, pal. Spidey jumps towards the collider. BUT-- Goblin rises, flies, then GRABS Spider-Man and SHOVES HIM into the beam/tiny portal. The beam now OUT OF CONTROL.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: Goblin, no! Get him out of there! Uh Oh. Goblin pushes Spidey's head INTO THE BEAM. PETER'S POV -- PSYCHEDELIC LIGHTS and UNDULATING THREADS. don’t know it yet but we are seeing a portal to the multiverse. SPIDEY starts to GLITCH STRANGELY-- --Spidey regains control, PULLING GOBLIN into the beam th HUGE ENERGY PULSE BURSTS OUT FROM THE COLLIDER, knocking everyone back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE, the PULSE WHOOSHES THROUGH THE CITY, KNOCKING TH

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS OUT TEMPORARILY-
dialogues.text: SEQ. 1220 - DEATH OF SPIDER-MAN “DOS”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PULSE wrecks the chamber. Miles has FALLEN THROUGH A IN THE FLOOR, smoke billowing everywhere. Miles scrambles by the remains of Green Goblin, crushed b some heavy machinery: DEAD. --Miles reaches A very injured SPIDER-MAN.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Hey! Are you okay???

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: (no, but plays it off) I'm fine, I’m fine. Just resting.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Can’t you get up?

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: (wry laugh) Yeah, yeah I always get up... (coughing) The coughing’s probably not a good sign. NOISES FROM ABOVE, shadows. Kingpin’s thugs have discover the hole. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) Listen, we gotta team up here, we don’t have that much time... --Spider-Man hands the SHUTDOWN KEY to Miles-- SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) This override key is the only way to stop the collider. Swing up there, use this key, push the button, and blow it up. Spider-Man swallows hard, his breath shallower, his voice FAST. This is serious--  35. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) You need to hide your face. You don’t tell anyone who you are. No one can know. He’s got everyone in his pocket--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --What?

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: If he turns the machine on again, everything you know will disappear. Your family, everyone -- everyone. Promise me you’ll do this.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: --Go! Destroy the collider. I’1l come and find you... it’s going to be ok. --Miles CLAMBERS UP A DEBRIS PILE TO THE FLOOR ABOVE-- Miles peeks up to the top of the collider... IT’S SO FAR THERE. Down below the conversation continues. Kingpin ent

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: Tombstone. We’re done with tests. Get that thing ready to go again. The scientist BACKS AWAY, runs. Kingpin shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run faster. These guys are weak. Kingpin approaches Spider-Man.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd say it’s nice to see you again, Spider-Man. But it’s not.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Hey Kingpin. How’s business?

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: Booming. Ha!

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Nice... Kingpin takes off Spider-Man's mask.  36. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) Aw, that’s a no-no. It's Peter Parker, 26 years old. BLONDE. SPIDER-MAN (CONT’D) This might open a black hole under Brooklyn. It can’t be worth the risk.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: It's not always about the money, Spider-Man. Prowler APPEARS FROM THE DARKNESS, advances on Peter--

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: (frantic) --Don’t you want to know what I saw in there?

dialogues.speaker: --WAIT...
dialogues.text: Kingpin’s hand raises. Prowler HALTS.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I know what you’re trying to do. And it won’t work. They’re gone. A flash of FURY and Kingpin delivers the DEATH BLOW himse A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: Get rid of the body. ON MILES, eyes widening. Miles moves slightly and makes DEBRIS fall.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was that? They follow the noise up to MILES' SILHOUETTED FIGURE...

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kill that guy. Miles RUNS. The Prowler takes off after Miles. SEQ. 1240 - PROWLER CHASES MILES “PCM”  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Miles races down the tunnel toward the LIGHT OF THE STATION. He HOPS THE FENCE, no hesitation. Prowler sprints behind with INFRARED VISION! A SUBWAY TRAIN IS COMING! Miles LEAPS INTO THE AIR and GR THE CEILING as the DEAFENING subway passes BENEATH HIM. Prowler WALKS TOWARD MILES as Miles realizes his HANDS AR STUCK! Miles swings his legs around to free himself as Prowler approaches. A nightmare come to life.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Stop sticking! Miles somehow RIPS HIS HANDS OFF, skin tearing -- OW! -- races out of the tunnel-- INTO THE LIGHT, clambering onto the PLATFORM, another tra coming, Miles LEAPS, just CLEARING IT. He runs upstairs. Prowler watches from the SHADOWY TUNNEL, unable to follow

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY VOICE
dialogues.text: Stand clear of the closing doors, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prowler whizzes through the busy streets on his motorcycl He drives right by a hiding Miles. Miles runs past a crowd that is gathering around the stra CLUSTERED TRAFFIC LIGHT we saw earlier(A remnant of dimensional glitching), taking photos.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKLYNITE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think it’s a Banksy. SEQ. 1250 - JUST KID STUFF “JKS” INT. MILES’ CHILDHOOD BEDROOM - LATER Off screen, a TV plays the news as MILES climbs through t window.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: .--New Yorkers are reporting sporadic power outages in the wake of another strange seismic event...  38. He's breathing heavy. He's freaked out and so scared. JEF VOICE rings out from O.S.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Police! Put your hands up!! --Miles? Miles? Jefferson sees Miles.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why aren’t you at school? --Miles runs up to his dad and embraces him. Jeff is confused, then seems to get it.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, it’s ok.

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: Miles? Que te pasa? Is it the earthquake? Miles looks at each of his parents, torn. Maybe he should confide in them...?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Can I sleep here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Miles, it’s a weeknight. You made a commitment to that school--

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: --Jeff, he’s upset. Rio and Jeff share a look. Jeff understands, softens.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Of course you can stay. Miles sits down on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --Yeah?--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: .+-Do you really hate Spider-Man?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: (beat, confused) Yeah? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) I mean, with a vigilante-- --Rio shoves Jeff out--

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: --Jeff, mi amor--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --What? He asked me. Baby, you know how I feel about Spider-Man, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: Mhmm... Jeff leaves. Miles, lies down on his bed. Rio tenderly strokes Miles’ forehead.

dialogues.speaker: RIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tu sabes que el te quiere mucho... That’s why he’s tough on you, you know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Mom, do you ever think about moving out of Brooklyn?

dialogues.speaker: RIO
dialogues.text: Our family doesn’t run from things, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Rio kisses his forehead. Gets up, LIGHTS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: RIO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s having a hard time, Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: When it gets hard, that’s Shhhh. Tiene que mas suave. when he’s gotta stick it out. Their voices fade. Miles take the KEY out of his pocket in a closed fist as MUFFLED SOUND of his parents’ voices fades away. Miles op his hand, revealing the KEY. Miles stares at it. SEQ. 1330 - PETER’S FUNERAL “PEF”  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rio and Jefferson watch the news. Miles sits up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: We interrupt this broadcast for a special report. Sad news tonight. The hero known as Spider-Man has died after injuries related to another powerful earthquake in Brooklyn. Over a montage of people around the city finding out Spid Man died, we hear...

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Multiple sources are confirming that Peter Parker, a 26 year old grad student and part time photographer, operated as Spider- Man for at least a decade, saving by some counts thousands of lives around the world. With these tragic seismic events on the rise, one can only wonder, is there anyone who can keep New York safe? People look at cell phones in Times Square.

dialogues.speaker: MULTIPLE NEWS ANCHORS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Peter Parker, Spider-Man, is dead. / He is survived by his wife Mary Jane and his aunt, May Parker. / Our hero Spider-Man is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles stands in front of a TV display at a store window. the TVS are playing the news about Spider-Man’s death. Mi looks at the TVs, his reflection appearing between photos Spider-Man and Peter Parker.

dialogues.speaker: MJ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My husband Peter Parker was an ordinary person. He always said it could have been anyone behind the mask. He was just the kid who happened to get bit.  41. INT. STAN’S COSTUME STORE - DAY Miles looks at a Spider-Man costume, deciding. Then BUYS from a COMIC BOOK OWNER who looks A LOT LIKE...

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: I’m going to miss him.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: We were friends you know.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Can I return it if it doesn’t fit?

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: It always fits. Eventually. Beat. Stan head tilts to a sign: NO RETURNS. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles puts the costume on and stares at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MJ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He didn’t ask for his powers. But he chose to be Spider-Man. He experiments, crouching in a classic Spider-Man pose. H relaxes then quickly tries another pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles walks in a sea of well wishers in full costume, man also in Spider-Man costumes, homemade and store bought.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: My favorite thing about Peter is that he made us each feel powerful. We all have powers of one kind or another. But in our own way, we are all Spider-man. And we're all counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (to himself) They're counting on me.  42.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL ATTENDEE
dialogues.text: (whispers to Miles) Probably not you specifically. I think it’s a metaphor. MJ backs away from the dais. Aunt May comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles rounds a corner and takes out the Spider-Man Origin comic book. He flips to a page that depicts Peter testing new powers by jumping from a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles RUNS UP A FLIGHT OF STAIRS, eyes determined. He BUR THROUGH A DOOR AND onto--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles walks to the edge, looks DOWN and then ACROSS to th neighboring roof, calculating the jump. He BACKS UP. Cracks his neck. Waits there. As the MUSIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles RUNS DOWN A FLIGHT OF STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, disappointed in himself for chickening out, eyes a SHORTER BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles RUNS UP ANOTHER FLIGHT OF STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BACKS UP. Cracks his neck...then RUNS, gaining speed-- --and TRIPS on his untied shoelace, FALLING TO THE GROUND BELOW. We make a meal of the fall, comics-style.  43. Miles lands with a CRACK (BURST CARD), and pulls out the which is now TOTALLY BROKEN. SEQ. 1400 - THE CEMETERY “CEM” - PART 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's snowing now. Empty and quiet. Footsteps on snow as M approaches Peter Parker's grave. He takes off his mask, looks down at Parker's gravestone sighs, then speaks, so softly we can barely hear him.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Parker... That thing you gave me, that key... (holds it out) I think I really messed it up. I want to do what you asked. I really do, but... I’m sorry. I’m not sure I'm the guy. I can’t do this without you. BEHIND MILES a DARK FIGURE rises, casting a shadow.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Kid!-- Terrified, Miles pulls his mask down and TURNS AROUND-- --The figure steps forward -- Miles panics and throws his arms up, accidentally delivering a VENOM STRIKE. The Dark Figure flies back as WEBBING flies from his hand and sticks to Miles, yanking Miles forward.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Woah!! Miles sits up and looks at his HANDS, the webbing. MILES (CONT’D) What did I do to him? Uh... Miles runs over to the body, pulls back his jacket and reveals a SPIDER-MAN COSTUME. MILES (CONT’D) No... Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEQ. 2090 - PETER’S FLASHBACK “PFB”

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Alright people, let’s do this one last time. My name is Peter B. Parker... PAGES FLIP FAST: "Coming next month! A Spider-Man from another world..."

dialogues.speaker: SPLASH PAGE
dialogues.text: QUICK FLASHES, similar but not identical to the ones we s in the cold open. High-energy running, fighting, leaping.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--I was bitten by a radioactive spider. And for the last twenty-two years I thought I was the one and only "Spider-Man". Peter on a gargoyle drinking coffee with the morning pape

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What a day...

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure you know the rest. INT./EXT. A rapid barrage of IMAGES from Spider-Man canon whiz by -- but with VARIATIONS and NEW SHOTS too. Instead Uncle Ben on the bed, for instance, it’s AUNT MAY.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You see I saved the city, fell in love, I got married, saved the city some more, maybe too much, my Marriage got testy, made some dicey money choices -- don’t invest in a Spider-themed restaurant... We see a few FAST IMAGES of Spider-Man doing his thing bu losing a step, swinging with coffee, etc.,standing in fro of a shuttered TGISpideys, signing divorce papers, HOLDIN

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--Then like fifteen years passed blah blah blah super boring, I broke my back, a drone flew into my face, I buried Aunt May, my wife and I split up. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (then) But I handled it like a champion. CUT TO Peter CRYING on the floor of the shower in his spi suit.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ‘Cause you know what? No matter how many times I get hit, I always get back up. Peter’s slumped like a slug in bed, wearing his costume. ALARM goes off -- he lifts up his mask and immediately pu it back down. He refuses to shut off the alarm, so it kee BLARING. He watches TV. A nature show. Seahorses reflecting in his SPIDER EYES.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And I got a lot of time to reflect and work on myself. Did you know that seahorses that they mate for life? Could you imagine a seahorse seeing another seahorse and then making it work? (then) She wanted kids and it scared me. Peter sits on the roof of a building looking at his phone deciding whether or not to call MJ.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure I broke her heart. (beat) Flash forward, I’m in my apartment doing pushups, doing ab crunches, getting strong-- REVEAL PETER, with his costume half on, eating pizza--

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --when this weird thing happened. --A TREMOR hits the room causing the same strange “color separation” we saw before. Peter’s whole body suddenly SH AND VIBRATES as he LOOKS UP-- --Where A PSYCHEDELIC PORTAL YAWNS OPEN, sucking him TOWA IT -- his body FLIES UP, halftones more prominent--  46.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O)
dialogues.text: .-. And I gotta say, weird things happen to me a lot. But this was real weird. Peter uses his limbs to fight but it's TOO STRONG... the portal CLOSES. The pizza slice drops on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halftone Peter flies SCREAMING through an INSANE MULTIVER trying to PULL HIS MASK ON... .--he is falling towards a STRANGE KALEIDOSCOPE OF SPIDER MEN, just like we saw earlier, towards the BRIGHT CENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter EXPLODES IN AN ENERGY BURST OUT OF THE COLLIDER (th pulse from earlier that spread through Brooklyn after Spi Man and Green Goblin fell into the beam). Peter TUMBLES and CAREENS through a BLUR OF CITY and NIGH SKY as his MOLECULES SOLIDIFY, finally coming to rest in-

dialogues.speaker: TIMES SQUARE
dialogues.text: Peter slowly stands, stares open-mouthed at STRANGE BUILDINGS, BILLBOARDS and STORES with close-but-not-quite right LOGOS.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..--You see I was in New York, but... things were different. Finally Peter looks at a ticker-tape LED sign in front of (National News Network-- a cable station): "NEW YORK’S HE

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Also I was dead. And blonde. I was kind of... perfect. It was like looking in a mirror. We cut from RIPeter to this new Peter, LIFTING HIS MASK. slick and new, one old and BEAT UP. CUT TO Peter at Spider-Man’s funeral. MJ gives her eulogy

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: My husband Peter Parker was an ordinary person. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He always said it could have been anyone behind the mask.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have a feeling the thing that brought me here, was the thing that got him killed. You wanna know what happened next? (beat) Me too. We see Miles "venom strike" again. SEQ. 1400 - THE CEMETERY “CEM” - PART 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles approaches the figure. A flash of spidey-sense. The figure looks like Peter Parker, but with BROWN HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: What are you doing over there? Freeze! PDNY! A flashlight finds Miles who STARTLES, hands up. --Miles decides to RUN! But he's tied to an unconscious b and is SNAPPED BACK--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me right now? Police approach, TURNING ON BODY CAMERAS. Miles gasps. Frantic, HE PICKS UP the immobile "Peter" ON HIS BACK--

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hey kid, drop the body! Miles PICKS UP SURPRISING SPEED, tracking FOOTPRINTS in t snow which Peter's dragging legs quickly blur.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hey kid! Get over here! Miles sees THE GLINT of the web shooters on Peter's wrist THINKING FAST, he aims Peter's arm to shoot webbing. The webs dart out and attach to a nearby tree. Miles and Peter swing forward--  48.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --See ya, officers!-- --then they CREST, and go SAILING BACK-- MILES (CONT’D) --Oh come on-- They SPIN THROUGH THE AIR then SMACK ONTO A WALL, Peter DRAGGING Miles down-- --Peter lands in the snow and Miles lands in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: C’mon now! Put em' up, son! Miles puts his and Peter's hands up. Flops the hands arou as he gesticulates-- --Miles accidentally uses Peter’s web shooter, firing it toward an oncoming elevated train... it CONNECTS!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Adios? --WHOOSH! Miles and Peter are WHIPPED OUT OF FRAME and DRAGGED away through the snow by the TRAIN. BAM! He slams into the PETER PARKER GRAVESTONE, knocked o as Miles PINBALLS from gravestone to gravestone-- MILES (CONT’D) Help! Somebody stop that train! SEQ. 1450 - THE SPIDER-MEN “TSM”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and an unconscious Peter get dragged through the ci The train lifts them up into the air, above the traffic a COP CARS FOLLOW BEHIND, SIRENS BLAZING. PETERS LIPS FLAP. The trajectory of the train lowers them down towards an unsuspecting BICYCLIST. Miles and Peter get tangled with bicyclist, causing him to go flying in the air (MULTIPANE

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (very groggy) Oh, hey, what the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They whiz through ONCOMING TRAFFIC, pedestrians, Miles tr to swing his weight around to maneuver through. Trying to lift up Peter, Miles instead forces his face IN THE GROUND. Peter is knocked unconscious again.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I’M GOING TO DIE!! Miles realizes he has to HANDLE THIS SOMEHOW-- --Miles PUPPETS PETER’S BODY, moving Peter's legs and arm parkour over cars, push off signs, anything to survive. Two COPS sit in traffic - their radio CRACKLES TO LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: .-.Looks like a child dressed as Spider-Man dragging a homeless corpse behind a train-- The guys hit the SIREN LIGHTS-- --Peter comes to again, so groggy..

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yes! I didn’t kill you!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: PETER MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (groggy) --I’m not! I’m trying to save Why are you trying to kill you! me?-- --BAM! Peter's head HITS a TRAFFIC LIGHT and he is KNOCKE

dialogues.speaker: UNCONSCIOUS AGAIN--
dialogues.text: Peter comes to again as they stuck to the side of a bus a slowly sliiiiiide along the window. The train keeps movin the web is STRETCHING TAUT... Peter comes to again, so groggy... Finally, the train stops at a station and they COME TO A at an intersection. Miles and Peter DETACH onto a sidewal surrounded by NEW YORKERS who simply WALK OVER THEM. MILES (CONT’D) Hey, uh, maybe you guys can go around? Alright. Thanks, New York.  50. SEQ. 2100 - GETTING ANSWERS, BOOM! “GAB”

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: PETER'S POV -- he opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What was that? Kid electrocuted me... with his hands? Peter, so GROGGY, is tied to a punching bag. The punching is tied with many many many many ropes. And computer cord Like a homemade spiderweb. Miles sits opposite him. A FLASH OF SPIDER-SENSE. Peter realizes what Miles is.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You're like me. Miles puts up a tough front. He nearly pulls it off...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (tough voice) I got some questions. Peter LUNGES erratically. Miles startles, frightened-- MILES (CONT’D) Why do you look like Peter Parker?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Because I am Peter Parker.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Then why aren’t you dead? Why is your hair different? Why are you older, why is your body... a different shape?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Pretty sure you just called me fat.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: No, no you just--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: --Hey listen, you don't look so hot either kid. Most superheroes don't wear their own merch.  51. Miles looks at his outfit and frowns. Why is this dude throwing shade at him?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --Are you a ghost?--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --Are you a zombie?--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: --Stop it--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --Am I a zombie?--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You’re not even close.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Are you from another dimension? (Peter is quiet) Like a parallel universe where things are like this universe but different? And you're Spider-Man in that universe? But somehow traveled to this universe, but you don’t know how?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wow. That was really just a guess?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Well, we learned about it in physics.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: --Quantum theory.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (realizing) This is amazing. You can teach me just like Peter said he would--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: --Before he died.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah, exactly.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright.  52.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Look I made a promise to him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Here’s lesson number one, kid. Don't watch the mouth. Watch the hands. Peter holds up his UNTIED hands. Miles is flabbergasted. Peter stands up. Before Miles can react, Peter leaps, kicks-spins the punc bag toward Miles, knocking him over HARD!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Peter, seriously-- --Peter WEBS HIS MOUTH SHUT. Peter BOUNDS to the window. Turns back... feeling guilty.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Trust me, kid, this'll all make you a better Spider-Man. Peter LEAPS FROM THE WINDOW-— --but his powers GLITCH, he FALLS. We hear him SCREAM, th hit the fire escape. SEQ. 1750 - TEAMING UP “TEU”

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Hey, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What’s going on with your body?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t think my atoms are real jazzed about being in the wrong dimension. (glitches) Look, I’m not looking for a side gig as a Spider-Man coach. I got a lot going on in my dimension, like a lot.  53.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: With great power comes great--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare finish that sentence- - don’t do it. I’m sick of it. (glitches) Want my advice? Go back to being a regular kid--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I don’t have a choice. Kingpin’s got a supercollider. He’s trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wait a second, what did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Kingpin’s trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Who cares about that? Where’s the collider?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Brooklyn. Under Fisk Tower.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Goodbye! Peter starts WALKING DOWN THE BUILDING. Miles sttuggles t FOLLOW. (Note: rest of scene staged like a classic NYC mo “walk and talk” but IT’S VERTICAL...and one of the participants HASN'T LEARNED TO WALK YET)

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: When it runs again, I’1l just jump in and get back to my life--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --You can’t let them run it. I’m supposed to destroy it so it never runs again or everyone’s gonna die--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (mocking) --Or everyone’s going to die. That is what they always say. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But there’s always a little bit of time before everybody dies, and that’s when I do my best work.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Aren’t you going to need this? Miles produces the goober.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ah you have a goober. Give it. Peter reaches out. Miles holds it back.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (holding it back) Wait, no. Not so fast. He called it an override key.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: There’s always a bypass key, a virus key, a who-cares key I can never remember so I just call ita goober. Give it.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I need it to destroy the collider.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I need it to go home! Miles puts it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (mouth full) No! I‘’1l swallow it, don’t play with me!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What? Peter starts to walk again, knowing he’ll provoke a respo

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (mouth full) I said-- Without even looking at Miles, Peter nonchalantly webs th goober right out of Miles mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey!  55.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The collider created a portal that brought me here. And I have to g-- (realizing) Did you break this?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: No, it... broke. I don’t remember what happened.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: This is why I never had kids, this is why I never did that.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Can’t we make another one?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No, we can't do anything. Thanks to you I have to re-steal what your guy stole from Alchemax and make another one of these.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Look, if I don’t turn off the collider after you leave, everyone in this city, my parents, my uncle, and millions of others will die, and you're just gonna go home and leave me here to figure this out for myself? You good with that, Spider-Man?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Peter walks away over the top of the building and disappe from sight. Miles, utterly defeated sits down on the wall. With his h in his hands. Peter peeks his head back over the ledge. Not so far belo the surface is the guy who used to care, but...

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Making you feel guilty. Is it working?  56.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: How could it, no-- Look at me, does it look like it’s working? No it’s.. no it’s... ohhhh... (screaming into his jacket) Ahhh!!! No! No! Do not let him win! Miles raises his head up to see Peter walk back towards h

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright kid you win. (then) C’mon, we don’t have a second to lose. Miles smiles. SEQ. 2120 - GREEK DINER _“GRK”

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. GREEK DINER
dialogues.text: --MATCH CUT Miles’ face, annoyed. Peter STUFFS HIS FACE while Miles watches. This is not a normal Spider-Man.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I love this burger. So delicious. One of the best burgers I’ve ever had. In my universe, this place closed six years ago. I don’t know why. I really don’t. (the check arrives) You have money right? I’m not very liquid right now.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Can we focus?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Uh huh sure.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: The other Peter--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (reaching for Miles’ burger) You gonna eat that? I’m listening.  57.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: The other Peter said he was going to be showing me the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: You got any Spider-Man tips you can tell me now?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah I got plenty. Disinfect the mask. You’re gonna want to use baby powder in the suit, heavy on the joints. You don’t want any chafing, right?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Nope, that was everything.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I think you’re going to be a bad teacher.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Mhmm.. Look up where Alchemax is.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (reads from his phone) A private technological campus in Hudson Valley, New York. (excited) You can teach me to swing on the way there. Peter LAUGHS. SEQ. 2140 - HITCHING A RIDE “HAR” TIME CUT -- Peter and Miles ride a bus through the Hudson Valley.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m not swinging to the Hudson Valley, Miles. Not after a hearty burger-breakfast. Keep your legs fresh, you’re gonna thank me later. As Miles shakes his head we CUT TO:  58. SEQ. 2300 - USE THE GOOD FEAR “UGF”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNZIP! SHORTS DOWN! MASKS ON! THEY SUIT UP! Reveal Miles wearing a YELLOW CAPE with his Spidey-suit.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And it’s a no on the cape.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I think it’s cool. Peter grabs the cape. Miles grabs it. A bit of a tug of w

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Take that off, it’s disrespectful. Spider-Man doesn’t wear a cape. Finally Peter yanks the cape from Miles. Miles and Peter lie at the edge of the woods SCOPING IT O Beautiful Zaha Hadid style buildings, a dream campus. Peppered amongst are THUGGISH GUYS in lab coats.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: So how do we retrace Peter’s steps?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: That’s a good question... What would I do if I were me...? (thinks for a second) Got it. Step One: I infiltrate the lab... We QUICKLY see MULTI-PANEL IMAGES of the mission going of without a hitch -- and with Miles barely appearing.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two: Find the head scientist's computer-- MILES INTERRUPTS HIS IMAGE OF A CLASSIC SCIENTIST.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: That lady with the bike is the head scientist. I saw her in this documentary at school.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Cool. Step Three: I re-examine my personal biases. Step Four: I hack the computer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Miles POPS into the multi-panel image of Peter download the override code from the scientist’s computer--

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: --It’s not technically hacking. It’s kinda--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (shoves him out) --Not now hold on, I just lost my train of thought... Step Five: download the important stuff, I’1l know it when I see it, and Step Six: I grab a bagel from the cafeteria and run.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: So what am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: --uh Step 7: You stay here, you’re lookout. Very important. Miles reacts.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Look, man you have to teach me to do Spider-Man stuff or I’m not going to be able to help--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (stretching) Alright... (swinging away) Watch and learn, kid, I’1l quiz you later! --Then he’s gone, stealthily swinging across the clearing toward the ALCHEMAX BUILDING, where Peter crawls down to GRATE, opens it, and ENTERS. Now Miles is ALONE IN THE WO

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (so mad) Why did I get stuck with the janky- old, broke, hobo Spider-Man? Miles PUNCHES the rock and cracks it. MILES (CONT’D) That’s new.  60. Suddenly a LIMO PULLS UP TO THE BUILDING, and who should out but KINGPIN, flanked by Tombstone, he walks into Alchemax. Miles FREEZES. MILES (CONT’D) Kingpin! He hides behind the rock, thinking. What does he do? What does he do? What does he do? --HARD CUT to Miles running across a field towards Alchem

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What am I doing? What am I doing? What am I doing? What am I doing? Miles looks over the side of the building, as KINGPIN and TOMBSTONE enter. He AWKWARDLY ENTERS THE OPEN GRATE into-- SEQ. 2350 - IN THE VENTS “ITV”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles crawls through. He follows Kingpin, with Tombstone, marching through the halls below. Kingpin blocks light fr below as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (whispering) Peter! Peter-- Miles isn’t looking where he’s going, so he fails to noti the LARGE BUTT ahead, CRASHING INTO IT--

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Peter!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah, what are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Kingpin’s here! Just move over! --Miles tries to worm up next to Peter. Miles and Peter complain like two brothers sharing a sleeping bag.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: C'mon! You're stepping on my foot!  61.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Move a little to your right--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Go back outside!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: No, I can’t sit there and just let Spider-Man die without doing anything about it. I’m not doing that again. Peter reacts. Softens.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (thinks it over) Most people I meet in the workplace try to kill me, so, you’re a nice change of pace.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD SCIENTIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uh, Mr. Fisk! BELOW THE VENTS, the Head Scientist leads Kingpin to a computer-- HEAD SCIENTIST (CONT’D) --Look at this data. I know you can’t really understand it, but these are really good numbers--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the computer and enters her password.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And... I got the password!

dialogues.speaker: HEAD SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: (shows photos of cluster poles and busses, etc.) Uh Mr. Fiske. If we fire again this week, there could be a black hole under Brooklyn. You see this? And this?
