Miles rolls away tries to get up. He’s hurt. He looks up and sees Kingpin coming after him again. Kingpin grabs Miles by the head a slings him against a pile of debris. Miles smashes into the ground, tries to get up and slips.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: The real Spider-Man couldn’t even beat me. You’re nothing! Kingpin is out of breath but he is enjoying beating the h out of Miles. Miles keeps GETTING UP and Kingpin keeps KNOCKING HIM DOW Miles keeps getting back up, he’s exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You took my family, and now I’m gonna make sure you never see yours again. Kingpin KNOCKS MILES DOWN AGAIN and approaches to finish off. Just then, a voice is heard in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Get up, Spider-Man! Miles eyes flicker open at the sound. He looks to the con room, where he sees someone moving around. It’s his dad.  123.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get up! C’mon... C’mon.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (struggling) C'mon... c’mon... come on... It takes him a few wobbly seconds but Miles staggers to h feet and faces Kingpin. MILES (CONT’D) I'll always have my family. You ever hear of the shoulder touch?

dialogues.speaker: KINGPIN
dialogues.text: What? ..-Miles drops a hand toward Kingpin’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: “Hey.” --As he touches Kingpin on the shoulder he delivers a

dialogues.speaker: KKAAAAAAA-ZAPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP
dialogues.text: Kingpin flies back from the force of the Venom Blast. Mil webs him and swings Kingpin into the panel-- MILES (CONT’D) Hey Kingpin! Push the green button for me! -- Kingpin FLIES INTO THE PANEL, a DIRECT HIT, making the Venom Blast extend to the entire collider room-- The beam starts to suck everything back in. Miles webs himself to the ceiling and holds on as the cha reaches a fever pitch. The beam retreats back into the collider guns, causing a MASSIVE IMPLOSION. In the control room, Jefferson is blown back by the force the implosion. THE COLLIDER SHUTS OFF. The shaking stops. Miles hangs from the ceiling. He did it. Some coughing catches his attention. From the debris of t observation room, he sees Jefferson stand up, coughing an shaking dust off.  124. Jefferson looks up and sees a spider web dangling but now MILES IS GONE. SEQ. 3175 - JEFFERSON AND MILES “JAM”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jefferson leads a handcuffed Tombstone into a cop car. As the car drives off, his phone rings. He looks at it. I MILES. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --Miles? Miles? Miles?! Are you ok? ANGLE ON MILES, as Spider-Man, perched on the corner of a building, overlooking the scene outside Fisk Tower.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m ok. (beat) You're probably busy so-- He’s definitely busy but doesn’t care.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: No no no no, I can talk! I can talk. Look, so I came by earlier because, uh... your uncle...

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I know Dad. I’m so sorry. A wave of emotion hits Miles.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Do you know who did it?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: I thought I did. But I was wrong. (a beat) Look Miles, what I said at the door, it wasn’t just talk. Look you know, I was thinking maybe we could find a nice wall privately owned--  125.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (getting emotional, holding it back) Ok, dad. Alright.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: --like at the police station and you could...”“throw” up some of your art? Man, I’m bad at this. Ok, Miles-- Miles? You there? (the line’s gone dead) C'mon man, C-Mobile-- Miles APPEARS right next to Jefferson with a POP--

dialogues.speaker: MILES AS SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Officer? SPIDER-MAN, aka MILES, right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: (startled) Spider-Man. Listen, down there, that was, I mean I owe you-- --Jefferson is startled when SPIDER-MAN HUGS HIM. He awkwardly pats him on the back. They break it up.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AS SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I look forward to working with you.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too, I guess. (then) I don’t approve of your methods but, we’re just gonna have to agree to disagree.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AS SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Thank you for your bravery tonight. (then, quickly) I love you. Spiderman walks away.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Wait, what? Miles walks off, shoots a web, swings away.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AS SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: And look behind you!  126. Jefferson turns and sees that Kingpin has been strung up webs between two buildings and there’s a note that reads “From your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man.” Miles walks down the street, high-fiving people. Everyone SO EXCITED TO SEE HIM.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Alright. Cool, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: BYSTANDER
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks Spider-Man!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yeah I’m Spider-man! A su servicio!

dialogues.speaker: BYSTANDER
dialogues.text: Yeah, you the spider!

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What’s up little man? Oh yeah, yeah I’m the new Spider-Man! Check it out-- (jumps onto wall, immediately falls off) Whoa! That was part of the move. SEQ. 3200 - WHY PHYSICS MATTERS TO ME “PMM”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MILES, swinging through the city.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: OK, let's do this one last time, yeah? For real this time. This is it. We see the OPENING BADASS SHOTS OF SPIDER-MAN but this ti with Miles.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My name is Miles Morales. I was bitten by a radioactive spider. And for like two days, I’ve been the one and only Spider-Man. I think you know the rest. I finished my essay. I saved a bunch of people. We see him do homework. Swing in front of adoring crowds. hit by a drone.  127.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Got hit by a drone. Did this with my dad. Miles paints a tribute to Uncle Aaron with Jefferson.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Met my roommate finally. Miles, upside down, fist bumps Ganke. Ganke is stunned. M slaps a sticker on a gargoyle at the top of a building.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Slapped a sticker where my Dad’s never going to find it. Ham, Peni, Noir, Gwen are in their homes, ready for a fre start...

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And when I feel alone, like no one understands what I’m going through, I remember my friends who get it. Gwen looks at a picture of her and Miles. Peter, holding flowers, rings the doorbell to MJ’s apartm Miles swings, flips, and runs through the city. He webs a train as leverage to CATAPULT himself through the air. He looks GREAT. It’s BEAUTIFUL, and SO SPECIFIC TO MILES.

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I never thought I’d be able to do any of this stuff. But I can. Anyone can wear the mask. You can wear the mask. If you didn’t know that before, I hope you do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles climbs into the top bunk, turning out the light, pu his headphones...

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cuz I’m Spider-Man. And I’m not the only one. Not by a long shot. He closes his eyes. Starts singing along to “Sunflower.” his eyes snap open as a bright light suddenly shines down him. A portal begins to open up above him.  128.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILIAR FEMALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Miles! Miles! Miles! You got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: SEQ. 3250 - “CODA” (CDA) FROM BLACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive lab space, so bleeding edge that it looks alien Holographic images of the Collider’s final moments (twist flowering cityscapes... giant floating pencils... Spider- etc) hover above the dozens of workstations filling the r We also get a glimpse of HEADSHOTS of Miles, Peter, Peni, Gwen. A HOLOGRAM WOMAN, Lyla, stands in the center of the lab, flickering from one screen to the next.

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: You're a bit late.

dialogues.speaker: SUITED FIGURE
dialogues.text: We can’t all be everywhere at once.

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: A little text might have been nice.

dialogues.speaker: SUITED FIGURE
dialogues.text: I was gone for less than two hours, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: Okay okay okay I know what it looks like but, here’s the good news--

dialogues.speaker: SUITED FIGURE
dialogues.text: --oh here we go--

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: --the multiverse DIDN’T collapse.

dialogues.speaker: SUITED FIGURE
dialogues.text: Oh cool!  129.

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: A little touch and go, but it worked out.

dialogues.speaker: SUITED FIGURE
dialogues.text: Great story. Hey, did you finish the goober?

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: It’s not a goober. It’s a gizmo.

dialogues.speaker: SUITED FIGURE
dialogues.text: Do you always have to call me out? It’s just really frustrating and it bums me out. She gestures to a crazy WATCH floating above a pedestal.

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: Don’t get too excited Miguel it’s just a prototype.

dialogues.speaker: SUITED FIGURE
dialogues.text: Not excited. The gizmo attaches itself to the Suited Figure’s arm. SUITED FIGURE (CONT’D) Okay, ow!

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: You could be the first person to make an autonomous multiverse jump... or the last. The suited character stands stock still for a long moment considering the watch. We begin to PAN AROUND HIM...

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Okay, so we’re just going to roll the dice on this?

dialogues.speaker: LYLA
dialogues.text: So what do you say pal? Where do you want to go first? .-. finally revealing a DEEP BLUE MASK. NO EYEHOLES. RED, DAGGER-LIKE LENS FRAMES...

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Let’s start at the beginning. One last time. Earth 67.

dialogues.speaker: A TRIPPY MATTE PAINTING
dialogues.text: From a Ralph Bakshi directed 1968 episode from season two the old animated Spiderman animated TV show. TWO SHOT -- Miguel jumps in to frame with the famous ‘67 ANIMATED MEME SPIDER-MAN.

dialogues.speaker: MEME SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Whoa... what the...

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: I'm Spider-man. I need you to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: MEME SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Who the heck are you?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: I just told you that, listen, listen. I’m from the future.

dialogues.speaker: MEME SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: How dare you point at me!

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: You were pointing first!

dialogues.speaker: MEME SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: It’s rude to point.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: You're being very rude! You’re not even believing what I’m saying. You're saying I’m not who I say I am. A POLICE OFFICER and J. JONAH JAMESON are standing nearby

dialogues.speaker: MEME POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Which one pointed first?

dialogues.speaker: MEME JAMESON
dialogues.text: Spider-man pointed first! Obviously! And we go out in pure chaos, the most expensive dumb joke all time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pointing at me right now as you say that! Look at you! Look at your finger! Look at your finger right now! What is it doing? You are pointing! You are accusing me of pointing, while your pointing-- 131.

dialogues.speaker: MEME SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: I’m not pointing, you’re pointing. I’m just pointing out your pointing. Which is different from normal pointing. You haven’t seen pointing until I get through with you and then you’1l know- “THE END” title card from the 1967 Bakshi cartoon. BLACK.
